intro: Pagamea guianensis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pagamea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
